column1: #Text=[0021] By connecting the TV 13 and the projector 14 to the two HDMI.RTM. outputs of the AV amplifier 12, a user is expected to enjoy two display devices separately depending on contents or situation.

#Text=[0022] However, while a remote control of the TV 13 connected to the primary HDMI.RTM. output is capable of operations such as fast-forwarding of the BD player 11 and volume adjustment of the AV amplifier 12 with the CEC control of HDMI.RTM., such operations are not performed with a remote control of the projector 14 connected to the secondary HDMI.RTM. output.
#Text=Therefore, viewing with the projector 14 is extremely inconvenient.

#Text=[0023] One example solution to this problem is to enable CEC control of multiple HDMI.RTM. sinks by holding a physical address of an HDMI.RTM. source virtually (for example, see Japanese Unexamined Patent Application Publication No. 2008-153974).
#Text=[0024] However, a method of Japanese Unexamined Patent Application Publication No. 2008-153974 involves a cumbersome reconnection operation due to resetting of HPD or operation of DDC.
